1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 /*global _: false, document: false, window: false, navigator: false */
  6 module.exports = function(AV) {
  7   /**
  8    * History serves as a global router (per frame) to handle hashchange
  9    * events or pushState, match the appropriate route, and trigger
 10    * callbacks. You shouldn't ever have to create one of these yourself
 11    * â€” you should use the reference to <code>AV.history</code>
 12    * that will be created for you automatically if you make use of
 13    * Routers with routes.
 14    * @class
 15    *
 16    * <p>A fork of Backbone.History, provided for your convenience.  If you
 17    * use this class, you must also include jQuery, or another library
 18    * that provides a jQuery-compatible $ function.  For more information,
 19    * see the <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#History">
 20    * Backbone documentation</a>.</p>
 21    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
 22    */
 23   AV.History = function() {
 24     console.warn("AV.History is deprecated, please don't use it anymore.");
 25     this.handlers = [];
 26     _.bindAll(this, 'checkUrl');
 27   };
 28 
 29   // Cached regex for cleaning leading hashes and slashes .
 30   var routeStripper = /^[#\/]/;
 31 
 32   // Cached regex for detecting MSIE.
 33   var isExplorer = /msie [\w.]+/;
 34 
 35   // Has the history handling already been started?
 36   AV.History.started = false;
 37 
 38   // Set up all inheritable **AV.History** properties and methods.
 39   _.extend(AV.History.prototype, AV.Events,
 40            /** @lends AV.History.prototype */ {
 41 
 42     // The default interval to poll for hash changes, if necessary, is
 43     // twenty times a second.
 44     interval: 50,
 45 
 46     // Gets the true hash value. Cannot use location.hash directly due to bug
 47     // in Firefox where location.hash will always be decoded.
 48     getHash: function(windowOverride) {
 49       var loc = windowOverride ? windowOverride.location : window.location;
 50       var match = loc.href.match(/#(.*)$/);
 51       return match ? match[1] : '';
 52     },
 53 
 54     // Get the cross-browser normalized URL fragment, either from the URL,
 55     // the hash, or the override.
 56     getFragment: function(fragment, forcePushState) {
 57       if (AV._isNullOrUndefined(fragment)) {
 58         if (this._hasPushState || forcePushState) {
 59           fragment = window.location.pathname;
 60           var search = window.location.search;
 61           if (search) {
 62             fragment += search;
 63           }
 64         } else {
 65           fragment = this.getHash();
 66         }
 67       }
 68       if (!fragment.indexOf(this.options.root)) {
 69         fragment = fragment.substr(this.options.root.length);
 70       }
 71       return fragment.replace(routeStripper, '');
 72     },
 73 
 74     /**
 75      * Start the hash change handling, returning `true` if the current
 76      * URL matches an existing route, and `false` otherwise.
 77      */
 78     start: function(options) {
 79       if (AV.History.started) {
 80         throw new Error("AV.history has already been started");
 81       }
 82       AV.History.started = true;
 83 
 84       // Figure out the initial configuration. Do we need an iframe?
 85       // Is pushState desired ... is it available?
 86       this.options = _.extend({}, {root: '/'}, this.options, options);
 87       this._wantsHashChange = this.options.hashChange !== false;
 88       this._wantsPushState = !!this.options.pushState;
 89       this._hasPushState = !!(this.options.pushState &&
 90                               window.history &&
 91                               window.history.pushState);
 92       var fragment = this.getFragment();
 93       var docMode = document.documentMode;
 94       var oldIE = (isExplorer.exec(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) &&
 95                    (!docMode || docMode <= 7));
 96 
 97       if (oldIE) {
 98         this.iframe = AV.$('<iframe src="javascript:0" tabindex="-1" />')
 99                       .hide().appendTo('body')[0].contentWindow;
100         this.navigate(fragment);
101       }
102 
103       // Depending on whether we're using pushState or hashes, and whether
104       // 'onhashchange' is supported, determine how we check the URL state.
105       if (this._hasPushState) {
106         AV.$(window).bind('popstate', this.checkUrl);
107       } else if (this._wantsHashChange &&
108                  ('onhashchange' in window) &&
109                  !oldIE) {
110         AV.$(window).bind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
111       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
112         this._checkUrlInterval = window.setInterval(this.checkUrl,
113                                                     this.interval);
114       }
115 
116       // Determine if we need to change the base url, for a pushState link
117       // opened by a non-pushState browser.
118       this.fragment = fragment;
119       var loc = window.location;
120       var atRoot  = loc.pathname === this.options.root;
121 
122       // If we've started off with a route from a `pushState`-enabled browser,
123       // but we're currently in a browser that doesn't support it...
124       if (this._wantsHashChange &&
125           this._wantsPushState &&
126           !this._hasPushState &&
127           !atRoot) {
128         this.fragment = this.getFragment(null, true);
129         window.location.replace(this.options.root + '#' + this.fragment);
130         // Return immediately as browser will do redirect to new url
131         return true;
132 
133       // Or if we've started out with a hash-based route, but we're currently
134       // in a browser where it could be `pushState`-based instead...
135       } else if (this._wantsPushState &&
136                  this._hasPushState &&
137                  atRoot &&
138                  loc.hash) {
139         this.fragment = this.getHash().replace(routeStripper, '');
140         window.history.replaceState({}, document.title,
141             loc.protocol + '//' + loc.host + this.options.root + this.fragment);
142       }
143 
144       if (!this.options.silent) {
145         return this.loadUrl();
146       }
147     },
148 
149     // Disable AV.history, perhaps temporarily. Not useful in a real app,
150     // but possibly useful for unit testing Routers.
151     stop: function() {
152       AV.$(window).unbind('popstate', this.checkUrl)
153                      .unbind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
154       window.clearInterval(this._checkUrlInterval);
155       AV.History.started = false;
156     },
157 
158     // Add a route to be tested when the fragment changes. Routes added later
159     // may override previous routes.
160     route: function(route, callback) {
161       this.handlers.unshift({route: route, callback: callback});
162     },
163 
164     // Checks the current URL to see if it has changed, and if it has,
165     // calls `loadUrl`, normalizing across the hidden iframe.
166     checkUrl: function(e) {
167       var current = this.getFragment();
168       if (current === this.fragment && this.iframe) {
169         current = this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe));
170       }
171       if (current === this.fragment) {
172         return false;
173       }
174       if (this.iframe) {
175         this.navigate(current);
176       }
177       if (!this.loadUrl()) {
178         this.loadUrl(this.getHash());
179       }
180     },
181 
182     // Attempt to load the current URL fragment. If a route succeeds with a
183     // match, returns `true`. If no defined routes matches the fragment,
184     // returns `false`.
185     loadUrl: function(fragmentOverride) {
186       var fragment = this.fragment = this.getFragment(fragmentOverride);
187       var matched = _.any(this.handlers, function(handler) {
188         if (handler.route.test(fragment)) {
189           handler.callback(fragment);
190           return true;
191         }
192       });
193       return matched;
194     },
195 
196     // Save a fragment into the hash history, or replace the URL state if the
197     // 'replace' option is passed. You are responsible for properly URL-encoding
198     // the fragment in advance.
199     //
200     // The options object can contain `trigger: true` if you wish to have the
201     // route callback be fired (not usually desirable), or `replace: true`, if
202     // you wish to modify the current URL without adding an entry to the
203     // history.
204     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
205       if (!AV.History.started) {
206         return false;
207       }
208       if (!options || options === true) {
209         options = {trigger: options};
210       }
211       var frag = (fragment || '').replace(routeStripper, '');
212       if (this.fragment === frag) {
213         return;
214       }
215 
216       // If pushState is available, we use it to set the fragment as a real URL.
217       if (this._hasPushState) {
218         if (frag.indexOf(this.options.root) !== 0) {
219           frag = this.options.root + frag;
220         }
221         this.fragment = frag;
222         var replaceOrPush = options.replace ? 'replaceState' : 'pushState';
223         window.history[replaceOrPush]({}, document.title, frag);
224 
225       // If hash changes haven't been explicitly disabled, update the hash
226       // fragment to store history.
227       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
228         this.fragment = frag;
229         this._updateHash(window.location, frag, options.replace);
230         if (this.iframe &&
231             (frag !== this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe)))) {
232           // Opening and closing the iframe tricks IE7 and earlier
233           // to push a history entry on hash-tag change.
234           // When replace is true, we don't want this.
235           if (!options.replace) {
236             this.iframe.document.open().close();
237           }
238           this._updateHash(this.iframe.location, frag, options.replace);
239         }
240 
241       // If you've told us that you explicitly don't want fallback hashchange-
242       // based history, then `navigate` becomes a page refresh.
243       } else {
244         window.location.assign(this.options.root + fragment);
245       }
246       if (options.trigger) {
247         this.loadUrl(fragment);
248       }
249     },
250 
251     // Update the hash location, either replacing the current entry, or adding
252     // a new one to the browser history.
253     _updateHash: function(location, fragment, replace) {
254       if (replace) {
255         var s = location.toString().replace(/(javascript:|#).*$/, '');
256         location.replace(s + '#' + fragment);
257       } else {
258         location.hash = fragment;
259       }
260     }
261   });
262 };
263
